plugins.name: React-Bootstrap
plugins.description: Quickly design and customize responsive mobile-first sites with Bootstrap, the world’s most popular front-end open source toolkit.

plugins.name: SASS/SCSS
plugins.description: Sass is a stylesheet language that’s compiled to CSS. It allows you to use variables, nested rules, mixins, functions, and more, all with a fully CSS-compatible syntax.

plugins.name: Axios
plugins.description: Promise based HTTP client for the browser and node.js.

plugins.name: Environment Variables
plugins.description: Use environment variables in your next.js project for server side, client or both.

plugins.name: react-use
plugins.description: A Collection of useful React hooks.

plugins.name: React Redux
plugins.description: Redux helps you write applications that behave consistently, run in different environments (client, server, and native), and are easy to test.

plugins.name: ESLint
plugins.description: A pluggable and configurable linter tool for identifying and reporting on patterns in JavaScript. Maintain your code quality with ease.

plugins.name: Prettier
plugins.description: An opinionated code formatter; Supports many languages; Integrates with most editors.

plugins.name: Testing Library
plugins.description: The React Testing Library is a very light-weight solution for testing React components. It provides light utility functions on top of react-dom and react-dom/test-utils.

plugins.name: Cypress
plugins.description: Fast, easy and reliable testing for anything that runs in a browser.
